location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.171 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter reports the recent seizure at Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh] of thirty-six slaves, carried out by the ruler of the town at the instigation of the British Agent at Bandar-e Lengeh. Kemball informs Malet that the slaves have been dispatched on the Honourable Company's brig Euphratesto the Presidency in Bombay, and that arrangements for disbursements (clothing, food, reinbursement to the chief of Bandar-e Lengeh] will follow. Enclosed with the letter is a translation of a letter (folios 319-29) from the British Agent at Bandar-e Lengeh to Kemball, dated 26 May 1853, giving his account of the retrieval of the thirty-six slaves.
